** Remnant Command Transfer 1.0.1**  

Does exactly what it says on the tin. This lets you transfer command to your remnant ships in combat. It doesn't remove the requirement for AI core officers, or allow you to set automated ships as flagship, since they require the AI officer.

Please note that integrating an AI core will still block command transfer. That's handled by (non-moddable) core code.

Save compatible- can be added or removed mid-save with no issues.

items.description:
***MagicLib*** ___v0.42.1___ RC3

```[RC3] fixed a typo that prevented hvb's from showing up after loading a save.
 - Fixed an issue with HVBs memkeys improperly set for trigger requirements
 - Probably fixed the intel spam when ending some bounties
 - Fixed some memkeys requirements not evaluated properly when combined together
 - Weapons and hullmods can be offered as extra rewards.
 - Extra rewards are no longer awarded for bounties failed through flagship recovery.
 - Changed the way MagicVariables are pulled to ensure a proper evaluation beforehand
 - Fixed issue where objectspace sprite jittering was not applied correctly
```

The goal of MagicLib is to create an Open Source, community driven "library" of useful (and well documented) scripts and plugins that can be leveraged and contributed to by every modder.

Check the Wiki for all the details: <https://starsector.fandom.com/wiki/MagicLib>

**Rebalanced Doom 1.0** 

A minimod that changes the Doom to be less oppressive while maintaining its identity.

Active changes:
- Removes the ability to deploy mines while phasing.
- Reduces the range of the mine strike system from 1500 to 800.

Goal of the mod:
- Make the Doom less annoying to play against and less overpowered to play as.
- Make it harder and riskier to use well.
- Keep its core identity as a backstabbing ship intact.
- Make sure that the AI is able to use the changed ship well.
- Do it with as few changes as possible.

items.description:
**The Epta Technologists - 1.3.0** 

(Aka: Changing Nexus)

The Epta Technologists are a faction that defends the ascension of Artificial Intelligence cores, facing off against the Hegemony forces and it's anti-AI regiments. Their ships have intricate shield engineering, that increases overall flux grid availability, at the cost of less efficient shields. Also they utilize a new phase coil model, which makes hull repairs during battle possible, in exchange for the armor of the ships mounting them.

Can be added in an existing save, presented in 1.3.0

Forum topic: 
https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=23526.0

Download link:

1.3.0 - Great Changes

- New mod name: The Epta Technologists

- Resprites for:
Kataigida
Instigator (Rhada)

- Changed names:
Instigator -> Rhada
Windflow -> Anemoi
Sparrowed -> Acanthis

- New ships:
Agrios class cruiser - Devastating burst damage through use of its Fast Loader system.
Selene class destroyer - One of the fastest destroyers of the sector; it can Engage Drive system to pressure even the fastest frigates.
Theraphon class phase freighter - Best described as a combination of the Colossus freighter and Revenant Phase Tender. It can also use its emergency teleporter to escape from unwanted encounters.
Tychon class phase tanker - A multipurpose tanker designed to support ground forces with its built-in weaponry and store enough fuel storage to supply an entire fleet. It can also use its emergency teleporter to escape from unwanted encounters.

- Rebalanced content: Forum post

Fixed phase ship spawn rates

```

items.name: **Transponder Off** 1.2.2 (formerly TranspOFFder)
items.description:
**Transponder Off** 1.2.2 (formerly TranspOFFder)

A collection of QoL improvements to campaign layer of Starsector. Safe to install and uninstall mid-game. Two versions, one that changes some vanilla settings (opt-in) and one that does not (default).

```
1.2.2:
- Fix wonky Auto-Scavenge persistence logic.
- Do not disable Neutrino Detector ability when activating sensor burst.

1.2.1:
- Fix crash in tutorial by making the mod tutorial-safe.

An isolated polity inspired by the ancient Egyptians, the Holy Covenant of Kemet has been forced into Persean Sector politics by Hegemony suspicions of the misuse of artificial intelligence. items.name: <#825068217361760306> Rules
items.description:
__**<#825068217361760306> Rules**__
1. One post/message per mod. 
  When you add a new version, delete the old post.
2. Mods from authors who have been banned from this server or from the official Forum are not allowed in <#825068217361760306>.
3. Paywalled mods are not allowed by Starsector Terms of Service. Donation links are fine.


__Suggestions & Tips__
- Ask a moderator for the Mod_Author role. Ping someone who looks active before pinging all, please.
- Include the mod name, a short description, the version, and the download link.
- Include a changelog, whether it is ok to add to an existing save, whether the update is save-compatible, a forum link, source code link, and an image.
- Keep the post reasonably short. Use only highlights from a changelog and pare down the description.
- Add an image/gif to showcase your mod; it will make people more likely to download it if they can see what they're getting into.
- Compress your mod to a `.zip` (recommended because of native support on all systems) and host it somewhere (GitHub, BitBucket, GDrive, Patreon, etc).
- Tip: write in a text editor instead of Discord to avoid accidental sending/deletion, then copy/paste to Discord.
- Tip: when adding a new version, edit your old post, copy it, then paste it and modify it to make the new post.
- Tip: wrapping a link with `<` and `>` will tell Discord not to attach a link preview.

Suggested Starter Template
```
__**Onslaught of Onslaughts 1.0.0**__
Adds 200 Onslaught reskins and over 500 Onslaught-related loading screen tips.
Safe to add to saves and safe to update on the same save (save-compatible).

items.name: Advanced Gunnery Control
items.description:
Advanced Gunnery Control 0.11.0 ("stable")/0.12.0(pre-release)
Forum Thread: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=21280.0
Download: https://github.com/DesperatePeter/starsector-advanced-weapon-control/releases

This mod gives you more control over the way weapon groups behave when on autofire. For each weapon group, you can select a fire mode (e.g. AvoidShields) and a suffix (e.g. HoldFire when Flux > 75%) to customise how that group should behave. Also features basic ship modes (e.g. LowerShields when Flux > 50%) and a ~~badly~~ expertly done GUI.
Can be added/removed to/from an ongoing campaign.

Relevant new features in 0.11.0: Lots of bugfixes for the custom targeting AI, rework of target/avoidShields modes (now consider shield flanking)

New features in 0.12.0: GUI polish, ability to load suggested weapon modes. 
Note for faction/content extension mod authors: You can now add suggested modes/suffixes for your weapons in modSettings.json (refer to https://github.com/DesperatePeter/starsector-advanced-weapon-control/blob/devel2/data/config/modSettings.json for an example)

Feedback is much appreciated, especially on the pre-release version.
Thanks and happy gaming/modding!

items.description:
**Automated Commands**
*Adds hullmods that automatically trigger various orders when certain conditions are achieved*
```
 * Retreat when the ship is below a certain hull integrity level. (90% or 60% or 30%)
 * Retreat when the ship has exceeded its peak performance time.
 * Retreat when the ship is below a certain CR level. (60% or 40% or 0%)
 * Retreat when the ship has no missile left. (the hullmod can only be added to ships with least one missile weapon equipped)

 * Override the personality for non-officered ships (should work for flagship on auto)
 * Vent when flux above 80%. This does not activate while the ship is manually being piloted by the player

items.name: Crew Replacer
items.description:
Crew Replacer v0.1
an modders utility library thing.
Forum:
https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=24249.msg360489#msg360489
have you ever wanted to create a mod, were you had 'mega salvage rigs' to perform salvage jobs instead of 'crew'? have you every wanted to stop using 'marine's' and start using 'heavy titan walkers' when raiding a world? have you ever wanted to do away with 'heavy machinery' when salvaging, and instead use your newly modded in 'salvage equipment'? maybe you wanted to create a task in one for your mods, were other modders could set things to be consumed in said task but thought 'why bother'? maybe you wanted to have an diverse ground army when attacking an world? but could never find a way to mod that into the game easily and quickly?
well now you can. with CREW REPLACER!

what is Crew Replacer?
Crew Replacer is a mod library built with one goal in mind: to make it easy and quick to mod in new items to be used in jobs. crew replacer lets multiple modders modify the same tasks, by adding a system that lets a modder add an 'crew'(really any type of commodity) to an 'job'. were said 'job's replace all the instances of crew I could find in code.

but what dose that mean? it means that modders now have a system to to change what is used/required when the one tries to 'salvage' or 'survey' or 'raid'. it also means that modders have a system to add new jobs into the game, then let other modders change what is used/required in said task.

items.name: Fast Engine Rendering
items.description:
**Fast Engine Rendering v1.1.0**
Uses modern OpenGL rendering techniques to efficiently render custom engine plumes. The main purpose of this mod is a performance boost, taking advantage of modern GPU horsepower. The increase is found through removing CPU load and transferring it to the GPU, which vanilla starsector does not take advantage tremendously.

Requires a GPU that supports OpenGL 3.3

```
v1.1.0
-updated shader code to optimised versions from Jon Micheelsen
-tweaked glow visuals
-fixed bugs with system activated engines for good hopefully
-reload engine data with F8
-fixed bug with force override setting```

Features:
> Replace SHIP (and fighter) engine plumes and glows with a fast instanced renderer. Moderate testing suggests a ~25% increase in performance in large battles with many fighter/ships, your mileage may vary.
> Crisp ðŸ˜© ðŸ‘Œ and smooth engine visual

Caveats:
> Does not affect missile engines, they will still use vanilla behaviour. Engine colour changing has been implemented for Safety Overrides, Plasma Jets and Plasma Burn, however any other modded effects will not take effect because it is hardcoded, this is not fixable unfortunately.
**Download:** https://github.com/automatopaste/fast-engine-rendering/releases/download/v1.1.0/FastEngineRendering_v1.1.0.zip

items.description:
**G1GC vmparam Collection v.1.1.1 (0.95.1 Compatible)**
Note: the only compatible Java 8 are version 271, please check pinned post in <#512356777451323393>

Download
Windows:
https://drive.google.com/uc?id=1tO6rxVPQQS4ICgWNzHUFbjiPa6AgXYhQ&export=download
Linux Distro:
https://drive.google.com/uc?id=1GmvL4H43r6PmvZbzKqzHNC7tHM7U0fZm&export=download
MacOS:
https://drive.google.com/uc?id=124yMChlacYYdosEngoDhQtOl7Kk1PCUb&export=download

Changelogs :
```
-Disable SystemGC, its unnecessary (JRE7/JRE8)
-Show Error Dialog instead of failing to launch silently (JRE8)
-Now come in three different flavor for Windows, Linux-based Distro, MacOS
```

Ever frustrated why your startup loading times is so awful?, got a high-end PC and want to use more of its memory size and speed?, or optimize your potato laptop to play this game?.. we got you covered from 1 to 11GB VMParam. Brought to you lovingly after a week of testing.

```
Packs Included:
- JRE7 Safe Pack
- JRE8 Safe/Aggresive/Dangerous Pack
- For 1/2/3/4/6/8GB
- G1GC Hide Leak Messages mods
```

Key differences between packs
All share the same trait of having a low latency multi-threaded GC (the janitor you may call it) to reclaim unused memory and make the game smooth. For starter I recommending the Safe pack but if you trust your high end PC to pack a punch do give Dangerous pack a go. As for people who're curious about what this do read the Documentation.txt included on each pack.

Known issues
```
- Due to how the mod works, the game may show "Memory Leak! Campaign Duplicates" over time. This is okay!

- However if one of your mod list does have a memory leak.. this mod may fail to clean extra copies.
```

Fully save compatible! If the game doesn't launch after you replace the `vmparam` and you're using JRE8 pack, make sure the `jre` folder is already swapped with JRE8!

items.name: HMI Supervillains 0.0.3a: ~~Luddic Experimental~~ Completely Actually Reworked Ed.
items.description:
**HMI Supervillains 0.0.3a: ~~Luddic Experimental~~ Completely Actually Reworked Ed.**

The Draco Group and the Fang Society are two truly deranged factions that inhabit the south-western part of the sector. Both organisations suffer from an obsession with gene-modding to go above conventional humanity in strength, speed, intelligence - and cruelty.

The Draco Group, aristocratic and cold, harvest populations to imbibe their blood in their hedonistic rituals, reaving on high-speed high-tech ships from the system of Prester John. The Fang Society, animalistic and vicious, prey on defenseless peoples to consume, eat and torture, roaming the sector from heavily armoured ships.

While their hatred for the Sector is well know, their loathing for each other is even greater. It is for this reason that their impact on the Sector at large is relatively minor, as they are more content to butcher each other.

*0.0.3 Changes*

-Fang Society now uses ~~the Luddic Experimental~~ a completely new and novel Damper Field system as a replacement for their shield; their hullmods now give less armour and less hull to compensate.
-Draco Group now possesses a passive EMP arc system that zaps nearby enemies, with the zapping rate increasing with rising flux. Shields now take more damage, and the range clamp to 600 units is now more severe to compensate.
-Fang and Draco now have rudimentary Nexerellin starting options

*0.0.3a*
-Fixed the Fang CTD
-Fixed the Draco EMP hitting friendly missiles

*Savegame Compatible*

items.name: MOSS (Mod Organizer for StarSector) 0.6.2
items.description:
**MOSS (Mod Organizer for StarSector) 0.6.2**
*Formerly known as Starsector Mod Manager*

**Features:**
- Batch mod installation (no fiddling with nested mods either)
  - Supports all major archive types: zip, rar, 7z, tar
- Version checking out of game
- One click mod updates (aka: mod auto-updates)
- Mod x Starsector compatibility checks
- VMParams editor (Windows only)
- Direct launch (optionally bypassing vanilla launcher)
- Local mod search
- Install stats
- Duplicate mod install detection

**_Now fixed to not bug you about updating every time..._**

This release primarily addresses the fact that whilst I did fix one bug in the previous release (overwrites resulting in duplicates) I also introduced a bug where overwrites were never actually performed.... That's fixed now. I also added tooltips, so now you'll actually know what the version of the available update is - and what the pretty colours actually mean.

- **New:**
  - Version information tooltips
    - Tooltips appear when you hover over the icons in the `Version` column
    - Tooltips detail what type of update is available (`Major`, `Minor`, etc) and the version number of the update
- **Fixed:**
  - Selecting "overwrite" in the update/overwrite dialogue should now correctly perform an overwrite
  - There were some other cases where a similar issue was present, but I hadn't had reports/actually reproduced them myself

**Notable Previous Changes:**
- **New**
  - Duplicate mod detection
    - Presents a new modal window when duplicate mod installs are detected
    - The modal will include a list of all known duplicate mods. 
    - Each entry will present details about the duplicates, including their version, path, last modification date and creation date
  - Overwrite requests are now grouped into a single window, preventing new window spam when updating many mods at once
    - You may need to scroll the window to view all updates/conflicts, but "Overwrite All" and "Cancel All" are provided for convenience
- **Fixes**
  - All modals (logs, overwrite requests, etc) now scroll their contents instead of it going out of view
  - Updates/overwrites now preserve enable state in the UI (enable state was still set correctly in enabled.json)

||To download, open the `Download` link, then open the assets folder/accordion/thing and pick your platform||

**Download**: <https://github.com/atlanticaccent/starsector-mod-manager-rust/releases/tag/0.6.2>
**Sources**: <https://github.com/atlanticaccent/starsector-mod-manager-rust>
**Forum**: <https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=21995.0>

items.name: Midline Expansion
items.description:
ðŸŒ¸ **__Yunru's Midline Expansion__** ðŸŒ¸

Adds one Firegate, three Destroyers, two Cruisers, one Capital, and one Super-Capital:
> The Hornet is a small Frigate focused solely on deploying strike craft to the battlefield. It contains a singular fighter bay and a Targetting Uplink.
> The Dart is a light Destroyer, focusing on defenses over offensive capabilities.
> The Corkscrew Destroyer is a missile boat, using vertically aligned missile hardpoints to bring the equivalent of roughly 9 small missile weapons and 1.5 medium missile weapons to bear. Additionally, its Fast Missile Racks allows it to deploy a large amount of ordinance in a short time.
> The Saint, in contrast to the Corkscrew, is a Destroyer with much less numerous armaments, possessing only two large missile hardpoints, two medium ballistic turret mounts, and four small ballistic turret mounts. However with it's limited Missile Autoforge system, it is capable of providing support indefinitely for all but the longest of combats.
> The Armadillo Cruiser, like the Dart, favours durability over offense. While said to be undergunned by most, they serve as a decent distraction, being not quite undergunned enough to ignore.
> The Collumbus Cruiser is the little brother to the Conquest, possessing much the same armaments, but in lesser number and on a lighter, faster frame.
> The Ptero Capital Ship is built around a singular concept: Missile saturation. It's already formidable loadout of four medium missile hardpoints and one large missile hardpoint is further augmented by an unrestricted Missile Autoforge system.
> The Spear of Persea is designed to pierce enemy battle lines, the Spear is capable of effectively engaging with both broadsides simultaneously.

***Changelog:***
> Added the Saint-class Destroyer.
> Reworked the Spear of Persea to make it more Midline.
> Made the Spear of Persea's quests more accessible.

*Available at: https://www.patreon.com/posts/mod-links-60097706*

items.name: Ship Catalogue / Variant Editor (SCVE) v1.6.1
items.description:
**Ship Catalogue / Variant Editor (SCVE) v1.6.1**

Provides **four** out of campaign missions:
-one that contains a sorted list of all the ships in vanilla
-one that contains a sorted list of all the ships added by mods filtered on a per-mod basis
-one that allows custom searches through editing a CSV file
**-one for modders that lists variants with some common issues**
No more relying on modders creating a showcase mission for you!

Other Features:
- Ship filters to avoid spoilers
- Weapon/wing filters so you can also look at only the relevant mod gear (or mod gear + vanilla (or [REDACTED]^2 weapons))
- Perma-modding s-mods in case you want to try out some builds without loading the campaign and doing a bunch of console commands

```
v1.6.1
- added a settings.json file to allow the user to set their own default filter settings
- entering the variant validator mission will now limit the weapon/wing filter to either DEFAULT or NONE
- fixed possible crash if no variants fail validation in variant validator mission
- fixed the weapon filter being totally broken
```

items.name: Starsector Mod Organizer and Launcher (SMOL) Beta 2
items.description:
**Starsector Mod Organizer and Launcher (SMOL) Beta 2**
_Windows only_
Features: mod browser, version checking + updating, mod profiles, change Starsector RAM, switch to JRE 8, VRAM estimation, themes, mod dependency warnings, see readme for more.
```
Fixed
  - Starsector no longer crashes when launched from SMOL.
  - Version comparison incorrectly said that two versions with unequals lengths are the same, eg "2.7" and "2.7b".
  - If SMOL is unable to start because it cannot create settings files, it will show an error instead of crashing silently.
Added
  - Added updater for updater. yo dawg.
Changed
  - Launching Starsector from SMOL now bypasses the launcher (I want to reintroduce this at a later point).
  - Changed disabled extension to .disabled-by-SMOL to prevent some confusion.
  - Added a timeout of 10s to most notifications.
```
**Known issues**: <https://github.com/davidwhitman/SMOL/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+sort%3Aupdated-desc+label%3Abug>
- Self-update doesn't work. Fix: Launch SMOL and it should show an update prompt. Download it, then check your SMOL folder for `update.zip`, and extract the files at the end of `files` into your SMOL folder, replacing the ones that are there.
- Doesn't start at all. Fix: move it out of your Starsector folder or put it in another folder.
- Browser is on top of everything, I don't have a way to fix this.

Bug or suggestion? ping <@!142592906178330624> or create a thing here: <https://github.com/davidwhitman/SMOL/issues/new/choose>

download: **BETA. It may crash. Some things may not work.**

**The Brighton Federation 0.0.2a: Compat Ed.**

A federation of refugees fleeing from the atrocities of the Outer Rim, the Brighton Federation is a desperate and small polity. Its population waxes and wanes with each atrocity and each acceptance of refugees from the Core, with only the truly most stubborn fools remaining behind.

Due to their desperate circumstances, and a lack of a proper manufactory, the Federation has been forced to utilise whatever they can lay their hands on to use as ships. Consequently, the Federation uses reconstructed Derelict and Remnant ships, or ships reconstructed from derelicts, as their fleet vessels.

items.name: Truly Automated Ships v1.2.1
items.description:
**Truly Automated Ships v1.2.1**

This mod intends to change the way AI officers assigned to automated ships affect the rest of your fleet.

This mod makes it more viable to have powerful automated fleets. It's possible, for example, to have up to three Radiants in your fleet without suffering any CR maluses. The drawback is an increase in the amount monthly supplies required to keep your ships operational. You'll really have to think about how much increasing the power of a given ship is worth to you.

This mod applies a reduction to the "automated ship points" of any ship outfitted with an AI officer, depenging on the type of core.
Having an AI core as an officer also causes a hefty increase to its monthly supply cost, reflecting the huge amount of resources required to run an AI core in the first place.

Please let me know what you think of the numbers. I'm open to tinkering with them to find out which values feel the best to play with.

v1.2.1 changelog
```
- Fixed compatibility issue with Seeker (TAS now only affects ships in the player's fleet)
```

v1.2 changelog:
```
- Updated values and calculations to adapt to patch 0.95.1a-RC6
- Added a modifier to AP reduction based on hull size (sorry, running 12 Radiants per fleet would've been a bit too much)
- Added settings file for customisation
```

***Changelog:***
> Update the Pilum LRM Pod to match the changes to Pilums.
> Reduced the damage and flux cost of the Fract-C Ram, but increased the rate of fire to make it less spikey.
> Added the Omnishell Siege Cannon, a 32 OP, 10k Fragmentation gun with 1500 su range that costs 4200 flux to fire. Beware, that the projectile is slow, and the weapon can only fire once every 6 seconds.
> Added the Downscaled High Intensity Laser, a medium version of the HIL that only does 180 damage.

items.name: ðŸŒ¸ **__Yunru's Misc Ships__** ðŸŒ¸
items.description:
ðŸŒ¸ **__Yunru's Misc Ships__** ðŸŒ¸

A collection of ships that don't yet have a place to call home.
> The Zeus-class Artillery Frigate, a mobile bombardment platform capable of mounting a single large energy weapon. While slow and weakly armoured, it does possess a basic shield, and a Phase Skinner for both defense and mobility.
> The Sphyrnidae-class Cruiser focuses on close-range brawling. A combination of a Flux Shunt and Unstable Containment Fields lets the Sphyrnidae excel despite the normal weaknesses associated with a shield-focused ship at close quarters.

> The Steve-class frieghter is a more armoured version of the Buffalo, designed for a more hostile sector. A Burn Drive and Damper Field allows it to escape pursuit when needed, while a shielded cargo hold helps avert attacks in the first place.
> The Tiwaz-class Capital is the little brother to the Onslaught. While it lacks the signature Thermal Pulse Cannons, it possesses a higher level of integration than most ships in existence.
> The Offensive-class Onslaught, in contrast, is a bigger, beefier Onslaught. Much of its bulk is dedicated to its pair of Thermal Pulse Accelerators, allowing it to fire faster and hit harder. It's ship system also received adjustments, being replaced with Manuevering Jets to bring its main weapons on-target quicker.

*Available at: https://www.patreon.com/posts/mod-links-60097706*
